Blog.post: I never get to talk about him in entirety.... And lately, more than ever, I'm disturbed with my inability to get over him.... I don't understand this. I hate him and yet I am unable to get my mind off of him. Even when I'm drunk I cannot stop myself from talking about him. And today I almost IMed him...I think I'm trying to tell myself that I did it so I could ask if he is still returning to RIT for college and is still going to be my boyfriend's roomate...but I just miss him and can't get my head back to myself. What the fuck did you do, Josh? What was it about you? Even after everything...I just don't understand. And now I find more saved conversations of ours, and I almost started balling my eyes out. I constantly listen to music you gave me, read poems that you inspired, talk about you...I can't think of a damn thing to say to you if ever we meet again, and chances are, we will with you about to live with my boyfriend. I wish he weren't going to be around, but at the same time, my heart practically becomes it's own person just thinking about seeing him again, looking at him, being in his presense.... I'm scared to death of you. One thing I will give him...he was an inspiration to my best poetry. There's no such thing as negative inspiration, in my opinion. Bad inspiration, yes, and he was and is that, but negative? When I am inspired to write wonderfully (or at least well enough to be satisfied) I cannot and will not complain. I could speak forever about you, I could have fucking lived for you, I know it's wrong, but it's truth and it makes me hate myself for even feeling that way. I can't help wondering what it would be like if I had him instead of Conrad.... Would I still be sweet? Would I still be caring? Would I still be kind? Would I be happy? It makes me sick to think I'll never really know. I hate myself for still loving him unconditionally. Something he never could have done for me.

Not sure how all this shit works yet, but I'm not too stupid, so I should be able to figure it all out eventually.... When One Eight Becomes Two Zeros Glad when you're near, And I'm sad when you're here. This is what's it's like to me. I'm mad when you're near, And I'm glad when you're here. This is what it's like to die. This all hurts me so much, That I honestly believe you're the one this is hard for. I bartered tack for wit, And I've already made up a billion stories about you. Knee deep in static, I hear you breaking up, I'm breaking up, I guess we're breaking up. You're not the other woman. You're just another, Another hobby for a guy like me. I'm glad when you're here, And I'm sad when you're near, This is what it's like to be me. You've given me a heart like a gun, And I'm so shocked that I made it through this billion days, Made it through these billion days. I didn't think I could tough it out for those days. Didn't think I could tough it out...a billion. Knee deep in static, I hear you breaking up, We're breaking up, I guess we're breaking up. You're not the other woman, You're just another, Another hobby for a guy like me. So we're growing, I'm sure. There's no other I can turn to. There's no other I can turn to. Knee deep in static, I hear you breaking up, We're breaking up, I guess we're breaking up. You're not the other woman, You're just another, Another hobby for a guy like me. I'm mad when you're near, And I'm sad that you're hear. This is what it's like to be me. I'm glad when you're near, And I'm sad that you're here. This is what it's like to be me. I'm mad when you're near, And sad that you're here. This is what it's like to be me. But I'm glad that you're near, And I'm sad that you're here. I hope you enjoy dying alone. --Glassjaw

"Come here," he said. I shook my head and he grabbed my boob so I kicked him in the balls. Abby grabbed my other boob and they started screaming about great tits.... Going to get trashed...going to get sick...going to fall down a few times too many and going to laugh and kiss a lot of cheeks.... I hope I don't get groped like I did last time.

Ok I noticed someone named AJay who puts a lot of poems in his blog so I thought I'd put some in mine that I wrote myself. The Warrior A fine beautiful day yet again I awaken to But for no one can see the impending doom Through all of the glory and innocence There is something more I sense For it cannot be described by one of the 5 And it is to strong to be disregarded as a "bad vibe" A chill runs down my spine, this is too good to be true All this happiness will be gone, quicker than soon For I had thought I had defeated all there was to defeat Left all evil behind, and happiness I will meet But wrong I am For it will happen again The chill gets stronger It will happen before longer I was a fool to relax I had not quite covered my tracks My tired face has seen more than most can imagine Oh how I wish I hadn't But my enemy is back to vist me again I thought I had defeated it then I have fought many battles with it In the end coming out much more fit Endless assaults upon my torn soul But yet somehow, I make it through them all My enemy doesn't have a name So I have no reference to point the blame But regardless, for me it doesn't matter much anyway For I live a quite harsh way Never ending fights, sometimes for reasons I do not know But each battle won and lost, my strength continues to grow For I am in my own right a warrior, this is my job some would say But deep down inside I don't wanna live this way I continue to fight, night after night Sometimes I think, just for the sport of the fight When will this end, I don't know For deep down inside, I have a tortured soul Even in moments of calm and assurance I know not for long, it will change from this For I live a life of torment I can never believe it will end Fight I will, fight on and on I will continue to fight, even after the fight is gone For there is no happiness in my life For all I see in my future is the continuing fight...

Ok I recently quit smoking and drinking everything...ok not everything just weed, cigarettes and alcohol. The reason behind this is that I need to focus more and those three things were making me tired, hungry and broke (not to mention RRRREEEAAAALLLLYY FFUCKKKEDDD UUPP!!!!). I will resume smoking weed and drinking after I move, but cigarettes are gone for good. I mean if they at least got ya fucked up then I'd keep smoking them, but unfortunatly they have no purpose other than to waste $7 of my money on a daily basis.
(23:49:12) TheSprintPCSMan: would you like to touch my penis? (23:49:12) ZolaOnAOL: Sorry, I'm a PG-13 chatterbot. Let's talk about something else.

I was on the ferry yet again and it was 3 in the morning. I had noticed a serious security lapse, the rope in front of the boat was down so anyone could walk to the front of the boat and lean over the gate (this was previously allowed until the ferry crash). I had to get some answers on why this was allowed in this dangerous gremlin and zombie filled world we live in today... James Smith: Hey why is the rope down? Ferry Captain: People take it down all the time, we put it up, they take it down. James Smith: Well I guess no one will notice at 3 in the morning Ferry Captain looks at watch and continues to help dock the boat

I was in the Staten Island Ferry Terminal waiting for the ferry and noticed a bomb sniffing dog and his trainer, I couldn't let the opportunity slip away... James Smith: Is that a bomb sniffing dog? Dog Trainer: Yeah. James Smith: How far can it smell bombs from? Dog Trainer: Pretty far. James Smith: Hey what kind of dog is that? Dog Trainer: A golden lab

I was walking down 42st and noticed a member of the NYPD's ESU division and decided to hit him with some tough questions... James Smith: Hey, what type of gun is that? Office: An M4 James Smith: Cool... (End of Interview)

Living in NYC you tend to notice the change in security measures after the 9/11 attacks. So I, James Smith, conducted some in-depth interviews with some counter-terrorism related personnel to find out a little more info on what exactly the city is doing to prevent terrorism. In the upcoming minutes you will be able to read these excellent examples of fine journalism.

Yeah, I haven't blogged in a while cause I've moved and have been quite busy. I'm gonna try to post more stuff in here when I get the chance now that I'm checking things a lot more often.

Another blog milestone! The first blog entry created on my cell phone. Yes my friends, created on a Motorola V400 then sent over the Cingular wireless network and routed to the Google web servers for your viewing pleasure! Ain't it great?!?!

Now that I got the new cell phone with the VGA camera and all that a thought struck me. As soon as I get email set up on this phone I will be sending pictures I take from my phone to my blog. Kinda like a photo journal of random stuff. More details to follow...

This is a pretty awesome movie I saw the other day. It has so many conspiracy theories it's crazy. It's basically about some soldier who gets brainwashed so he can become the first corporate owned President of the United States and it's up to Denzel Washington to stop him. That's all I'll say cause I don't wanna give too much away.
Any clue on when this is coming out? I've been hearing all about free invites and stuff but I just wanna know when it's official release date is and I have yet to hear anything,

Yeah I just finished reading this book, it's really good. Basically it's a compilation of the cartoon strip written by Tom Tomorrow. They highlight all of the shortcomings of the U.S. goverment but with a comedic twist. It also explains a lot of events and such that the average person never knew about (like how Phillip Morris [the cigarette company] owns Kraft Foods and other "innocent companies"). Check it out!
